verbs.description: Democrats [V: are] trying to close a loophole that may have let President Donald Trump 's longtime lawyer Michael Cohen accept controversial payments totaling millions from major corporations .

[ARG0: Democrats] are [V: trying] [ARG1: to close a loophole that may have let President Donald Trump 's longtime lawyer Michael Cohen accept controversial payments totaling millions from major corporations] .

[ARG0: Democrats] are trying to [V: close] [ARG1: a loophole that may have let President Donald Trump 's longtime lawyer Michael Cohen accept controversial payments totaling millions from major corporations] .
Democrats are trying to close a loophole that [V: may] have let President Donald Trump 's longtime lawyer Michael Cohen accept controversial payments totaling millions from major corporations .
Democrats are trying to close a loophole that may [V: have] let President Donald Trump 's longtime lawyer Michael Cohen accept controversial payments totaling millions from major corporations .

Democrats are trying to close [ARG0: a loophole] [R-ARG0: that] [ARGM-MOD: may] have [V: let] [ARG1: President Donald Trump 's longtime lawyer Michael Cohen accept controversial payments totaling millions from major corporations] .

Democrats are trying to close a loophole that may have let [ARG0: President Donald Trump 's longtime lawyer Michael Cohen] [V: accept] [ARG1: controversial payments totaling millions from major corporations] .

Democrats are trying to close a loophole that may have let President Donald Trump 's longtime lawyer Michael Cohen accept [ARG1: controversial payments] [V: totaling] [ARG2: millions] [ARG2: from major corporations] .
